message_1: Encrypt the message "HELLO" using a substitution cipher where "A" is replaced by "B", "B" is replaced by "D", "C" is replaced by "F", "D" is replaced by "G", "E" is replaced by "I", "F" is replaced by "L", "G" is replaced by "N", "H" is replaced by "P", "I" is replaced by "R", "J" is replaced by "T", "K" is replaced by "W", "L" is replaced by "Y", "M" is replaced by "A", "N" is replaced by "C", "O" is replaced by "E", "P" is replaced by "H", "Q" is replaced by "K", "R" is replaced by "M", "S" is replaced by "O", "T" is replaced by "Q", "U" is replaced by "S", "V" is replaced by "U", "W" is replaced by "X", "X" is replaced by "Z", "Y" is replaced by "B", and "Z" is replaced by "D".
message_2:
Using the given substitution cipher, the encrypted message for "HELLO" is:

H -> P
E -> I
L -> Y
L -> Y
O -> E

So, the encrypted message is "PIYYE".
